instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-3115 no PM_SLP_S3_L
threads.message:
Got in 3115 board.  green light and charges but no power or fan spin.  found 
no voltage on pm_slp_s3_l
.09v on pp3v3_s0  
no power on pp3v3_s0 enable
pm_slp_s3_r_l = 0v
p3v3s3_en = 0v
p3v3s0_en_L = 3.31v
p3v4_s0_ss = 3.34v

Could this be U1800 or smc?

threads.title: 820-3115 no PM_SLP_S3_L
threads.message:
Great info....
What about PPBUS, 3V3_S5, history of the board?

threads.title: 820-3115 no PM_SLP_S3_L
threads.message:
G3h = 12.59v
pbus s5 = 12.59v
pbus s0 = 0v

3v3_s5 = 3.32v

liquid spill looks like it got a little everywhere, no obvious corrosion or fried parts. found a little corrosion on insn_hs_other_p but it has 12.5v.

threads.title: 820-3115 no PM_SLP_S3_L
threads.message: Voltage on C1802/03. Clock chip corroded? Board cleaned?

threads.title: 820-3115 no PM_SLP_S3_L
threads.message: 3.3v on both c1802 and 03.  y2605 had some rainbow looks on the top of it so i replaced that the clock chip and a few others near by that had crap on them just for good measures,  still same problem.  I have not cleaned the board yet been holding out until looked into everything possible first.  i guess now would be a good time to clean it?
